artists.name: Françoise Hardy
artists.description: French pop singer and fashion icon of the 1960s.

artists.name: France Gall
artists.description: French pop singer who won Eurovision in 1965.

artists.name: Serge Gainsbourg
artists.description: Provocative French singer-songwriter and cultural icon.

artists.name: Jane Birkin
artists.description: British-French actress and singer, muse to Serge Gainsbourg. She made the Birkin Bag famous.

artists.name: Udo Jürgens
artists.description: Austrian-German Schlager singer and Eurovision winner.

artists.name: Karlheinz Stockhausen
artists.description: German composer and early experimentalist in electronic music.

artists.name: Armando Trovajoli
artists.description: Italian composer and film score maestro.

artists.name: Pablo Piccioni
artists.description: Italian composer known for his innovative arrangements.

artists.name: Piero Ummiliani
artists.description: Italian composer and pioneer of library music.

artists.name: Joan Manuel Serrat
artists.description: Catalan singer-songwriter and poet.

artists.name: Paco de Lucía
artists.description: Flamenco innovator who revolutionized the genre.

artists.name: Amália Rodrigues
artists.description: Portuguese fado queen and cultural ambassador.

artists.name: Mikis Theodorakis
artists.description: Greek composer and political activist.

artists.name: Nana Mouskouri
artists.description: Greek singer with one of the most distinctive voices in European music.

artists.name: Illés
artists.description: Hungarian rock band that defined the country's 1960s sound.

artists.name: Czerwone Gitary
artists.description: Poland's 'Beatles' - the most popular Polish rock band of the 1960s.

artists.name: Marta Kubišová
artists.description: Czech singer who was later blacklisted during the communist regime.

artists.name: Jan Johansson
artists.description: Swedish jazz pianist who fused jazz with Swedish folk music.

artists.name: The Hep Stars
artists.description: Swedish beat band featuring Benny Andersson pre-ABBA.

artists.name: Vladimir Vysotsky
artists.description: Russian bard singer whose songs became anthems of resistance.

artists.name: Eduard Khil
artists.description: Soviet crooner who later became the 'Trololo Man,' but in the 60s was a state-approved singer.
